natural problem: Evaluate $\frac{7!+8!}{6!+7!}$. Express your answer as a common fraction.
natural solution: We notice that 6! is a common factor of the numerator and denominator and then simplify: \begin{align} \frac{7!+8!}{6!+7!} &= \frac{7\cdot6!+8\cdot7\cdot6!}{6!+7\cdot6!} \\ &=\frac{6!(7+8\cdot7)}{6! (1+7)} \\

a_0.formal problem:
theorem
fixes fact :: "nat \<Rightarrow> nat"
assumes h0 : "\<forall>n. fact n = prod {1..n}"
and h1 : "fact 6 + fact 7 \<noteq> 0"
shows  "(fact 7 + fact 8) / (fact 6 + fact 7) = 63 / 8"
a_0.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Evaluate $\frac{7!+8!}{6!+7!}$. Express your answer as a common fraction. The final Answer is \frac{63}{8}
 ### Proof
 We notice that 6! is a common factor of the numerator and denominator and then simplify: \begin{align} \frac{7!+8!}{6!+7!} &= \frac{7\cdot6!+8\cdot7\cdot6!}{6!+7\cdot6!} \\ &=\frac{6!(7+8\cdot7)}{6! (1+7)} \\
 &=\frac{7+56}{1+7}\\ &=\boxed{\frac{63}{8}}\\ \end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes fact :: "nat \<Rightarrow> nat"
assumes h0 : "\<forall>n. fact n = prod {1..n}"
and h1 : "fact 6 + fact 7 \<noteq> 0"
shows  "(fact 7 + fact 8) / (fact 6 + fact 7) = 63 / 8"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_0.informal problem: If $fact(n)$ denotes the factorial of $n$, or the product of all positive integers up to and including $n$, find the value of the expression $\frac{fact(7) + fact(8)}{fact(6) + fact(7)}$. The final answer is $\frac{63}{8}$.

a_1.formal problem:
theorem
fixes fact :: "nat \<Rightarrow> nat"
assumes h0 : "fact = (\<lambda>n. if n = 0 then 1 else n * fact (n - 1))"
shows  "(fact 7 + fact 8) / (fact 6 + fact 7) = 63 / 8"
a_1.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Evaluate $\frac{7!+8!}{6!+7!}$. Express your answer as a common fraction. The final Answer is \frac{63}{8}
 ### Proof
 We notice that 6! is a common factor of the numerator and denominator and then simplify: \begin{align} \frac{7!+8!}{6!+7!} &= \frac{7\cdot6!+8\cdot7\cdot6!}{6!+7\cdot6!} \\ &=\frac{6!(7+8\cdot7)}{6! (1+7)} \\
 &=\frac{7+56}{1+7}\\ &=\boxed{\frac{63}{8}}\\ \end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes fact :: "nat \<Rightarrow> nat"
assumes h0 : "fact = (\<lambda>n. if n = 0 then 1 else n * fact (n - 1))"
shows  "(fact 7 + fact 8) / (fact 6 + fact 7) = 63 / 8"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_1.informal problem: If the factorial function is defined as $f(n) = \begin{cases} 1 & \text{if } n=0 \\ n \cdot f(n-1) & \text{otherwise} \end{cases}$, find the value of $\frac{f(7) + f(8)}{f(6) + f(7)}$. The final answer is $\frac{63}{8}$.

a_2.formal problem:
theorem
fixes factorial :: "nat \<Rightarrow> nat"
assumes h0 : "factorial 0 = 1"
and h1 : "\<forall>n. factorial (Suc n) = Suc n * factorial n"
shows  "(factorial 7 + factorial 8) / (factorial 6 + factorial 7) = (63::real) / (8::real)"
a_2.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Evaluate $\frac{7!+8!}{6!+7!}$. Express your answer as a common fraction. The final Answer is \frac{63}{8}
 ### Proof
 We notice that 6! is a common factor of the numerator and denominator and then simplify: \begin{align} \frac{7!+8!}{6!+7!} &= \frac{7\cdot6!+8\cdot7\cdot6!}{6!+7\cdot6!} \\ &=\frac{6!(7+8\cdot7)}{6! (1+7)} \\
 &=\frac{7+56}{1+7}\\ &=\boxed{\frac{63}{8}}\\ \end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes factorial :: "nat \<Rightarrow> nat"
assumes h0 : "factorial 0 = 1"
and h1 : "\<forall>n. factorial (Suc n) = Suc n * factorial n"
shows  "(factorial 7 + factorial 8) / (factorial 6 + factorial 7) = (63::real) / (8::real)"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_2.informal problem: Calculate the value of the following expression: $\frac{7! + 8!}{6! + 7!}$. The final answer is $\frac{63}{8}$.

fixes fact :: "nat \<Rightarrow> nat"
assumes h0 : "fact = (\<lambda>n. if n = 0 then 1 else n * fact (n - 1))"
shows  "(fact 7 + fact 8) / (fact 6 + fact 7) = 63 / 8"

a_4.formal problem:
theorem
fixes fact :: "nat \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> n. fact n = prod_list (map real [1..n])"
shows  "(fact 7 + fact 8) / (fact 6 + fact 7) = 63 / 8"
a_4.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Evaluate $\frac{7!+8!}{6!+7!}$. Express your answer as a common fraction. The final Answer is \frac{63}{8}
 ### Proof
 We notice that 6! is a common factor of the numerator and denominator and then simplify: \begin{align} \frac{7!+8!}{6!+7!} &= \frac{7\cdot6!+8\cdot7\cdot6!}{6!+7\cdot6!} \\ &=\frac{6!(7+8\cdot7)}{6! (1+7)} \\
 &=\frac{7+56}{1+7}\\ &=\boxed{\frac{63}{8}}\\ \end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes fact :: "nat \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> n. fact n = prod_list (map real [1..n])"
shows  "(fact 7 + fact 8) / (fact 6 + fact 7) = 63 / 8"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_4.informal problem: Calculate the value of the expression $\frac{(7! + 8!)}{(6! + 7!)}$. The final answer is $\frac{63}{8}$.

fixes fact :: "nat \<Rightarrow> nat"
assumes h0 : "fact = (\<lambda> n. if n = 0 then 1 else n * fact (n - 1))"
shows  "(fact 7 + fact 8) / (fact 6 + fact 7) = 63 / 8"
a_5.formal solution:

 ### Proof
 We notice that 6! is a common factor of the numerator and denominator and then simplify: \begin{align} \frac{7!+8!}{6!+7!} &= \frac{7\cdot6!+8\cdot7\cdot6!}{6!+7\cdot6!} \\ &=\frac{6!(7+8\cdot7)}{6! (1+7)} \\

theorem
fixes fact :: "nat \<Rightarrow> nat"
assumes h0 : "fact = (\<lambda> n. if n = 0 then 1 else n * fact (n - 1))"
shows  "(fact 7 + fact 8) / (fact 6 + fact 7) = 63 / 8"
 proof-

fixes fact :: "nat \<Rightarrow> nat"
assumes h0 : "fact = (\<lambda>n. if n = 0 then 1 else fact (n - 1) * n)"
shows  "((fact 7) + (fact 8)) / ((fact 6) + (fact 7)) = 63 / 8"

fixes fact :: "nat \<Rightarrow> nat"
assumes h0 : "fact = (\<lambda>n. if n = 0 then 1 else fact (n - 1) * n)"
shows  "((fact 7) + (fact 8)) / ((fact 6) + (fact 7)) = 63 / 8"
 proof-

a_6.informal problem: If the factorial function is defined as $fact(n) = n!$, find the value of $\frac{(7! + 8!)}{(6! + 7!)}$. The final answer is $\frac{63}{8}$.

a_7.formal problem:
theorem
fixes fact :: "nat \<Rightarrow> nat"
assumes h0 : "fact = (\<lambda>n. if n = 0 then 1 else n * fact (n - 1))"
shows  "(\<frac>(fact 7 + fact 8)}{(fact 6 + fact 7)}) = (\<frac>63{8})"
a_7.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Evaluate $\frac{7!+8!}{6!+7!}$. Express your answer as a common fraction. The final Answer is \frac{63}{8}
 ### Proof
 We notice that 6! is a common factor of the numerator and denominator and then simplify: \begin{align} \frac{7!+8!}{6!+7!} &= \frac{7\cdot6!+8\cdot7\cdot6!}{6!+7\cdot6!} \\ &=\frac{6!(7+8\cdot7)}{6! (1+7)} \\

fixes fact :: "nat \<Rightarrow> nat"
assumes h0 : "fact = (\<lambda>n. if n = 0 then 1 else n * fact (n - 1))"
shows  "(\<frac>(fact 7 + fact 8)}{(fact 6 + fact 7)}) = (\<frac>63{8})"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_7.informal problem: Evaluate the expression $\frac{7! + 8!}{6! + 7!}$. Express your answer as a fraction. The final answer is $\frac{63}{8}$.

a_8.formal problem:
theorem
fixes factorial :: "nat \<Rightarrow> nat"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> n. factorial (Suc n) = (Suc n) * factorial n"
and h1 : "factorial 0 = 1"
shows  "(factorial 7 + factorial 8) / (factorial 6 + factorial 7) = (63::rat) / 8"
a_8.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Evaluate $\frac{7!+8!}{6!+7!}$. Express your answer as a common fraction. The final Answer is \frac{63}{8}
 ### Proof
 We notice that 6! is a common factor of the numerator and denominator and then simplify: \begin{align} \frac{7!+8!}{6!+7!} &= \frac{7\cdot6!+8\cdot7\cdot6!}{6!+7\cdot6!} \\ &=\frac{6!(7+8\cdot7)}{6! (1+7)} \\
 &=\frac{7+56}{1+7}\\ &=\boxed{\frac{63}{8}}\\ \end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes factorial :: "nat \<Rightarrow> nat"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> n. factorial (Suc n) = (Suc n) * factorial n"
and h1 : "factorial 0 = 1"
shows  "(factorial 7 + factorial 8) / (factorial 6 + factorial 7) = (63::rat) / 8"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_8.informal problem: Find the value of $\frac{(7!+8!)}{(6!+7!)}$ as a rational number. The final answer is $\frac{63}{8}$.

a_9.formal problem:
theorem
fixes factorial :: "nat \<Rightarrow> nat"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> n. factorial n = (if n = 0 then 1 else n * factorial (n - 1))"
and h1 : "factorial 6 + factorial 7 \<noteq> 0"
shows  "(factorial 7 + factorial 8) / (factorial 6 + factorial 7) = 63 / 8"
a_9.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Evaluate $\frac{7!+8!}{6!+7!}$. Express your answer as a common fraction. The final Answer is \frac{63}{8}
 ### Proof
 We notice that 6! is a common factor of the numerator and denominator and then simplify: \begin{align} \frac{7!+8!}{6!+7!} &= \frac{7\cdot6!+8\cdot7\cdot6!}{6!+7\cdot6!} \\ &=\frac{6!(7+8\cdot7)}{6! (1+7)} \\
 &=\frac{7+56}{1+7}\\ &=\boxed{\frac{63}{8}}\\ \end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes factorial :: "nat \<Rightarrow> nat"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> n. factorial n = (if n = 0 then 1 else n * factorial (n - 1))"
and h1 : "factorial 6 + factorial 7 \<noteq> 0"
shows  "(factorial 7 + factorial 8) / (factorial 6 + factorial 7) = 63 / 8"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_9.informal problem: If the factorial function is defined by $factorial(n) = n! = n \times (n-1) \times \cdots \times 1$ for $n > 0$ and $factorial(0) = 1$, find the value of $\frac{7! + 8!}{6! + 7!}$. The final answer is $\frac{63}{8}$.
